Description: Rectangular ivory or bone label: blackened by burning and slightly broken at the top right-hand corner, where there was a hole for attachment. The front surface is inscribed. The reverse side of the label bears a single incised sign.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl. V, 2; R. Weill, ‘Recherches sur la première dynastie et les temps prépharaoniques' I (Cairo, 1961), 131; J. Vandier, 'Manuel d'Archeologie egyptienne', I, (2), 843, fig. 563, (2); P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit II (Wiesbaden, 1964), 981, n. 1552.
Associated places: Topographic representation of: Tell el-Farain, palace (?) (?)
